metadata.name: lazy-vs-eager-benchmark
metadata.description: Benchmark dataset for comparing Lazy vs Eager GraphRAG strategies (F6.2.4)
metadata.author: GraphRAG Evaluation Team

queries.question: What is the purchase order approval workflow?
queries.expectedAnswer: The purchase order approval workflow includes requisition creation, manager approval, budget verification, and final procurement sign-off.
queries.notes: Tests focused retrieval on a single process

queries.question: Who are the key stakeholders in vendor management?
queries.expectedAnswer: Key stakeholders include Procurement Manager, Legal Counsel for contracts, Finance for payments, and Quality Assurance for vendor audits.

queries.question: How do the ERP system and inventory management integrate?
queries.expectedAnswer: The ERP system integrates with inventory management through real-time stock level syncing, automated reorder triggers, and unified reporting dashboards.

queries.question: What compliance requirements govern data retention policies?
queries.expectedAnswer: Data retention policies must comply with GDPR 7-year financial records requirement, SOX audit trail mandates, and industry-specific regulations.

queries.question: Summarize the main business processes across all departments.
queries.expectedAnswer: Main processes include Procure-to-Pay (Finance), Order-to-Cash (Sales), Hire-to-Retire (HR), and Plan-to-Produce (Operations).

queries.question: What are the critical dependencies between IT systems?
queries.expectedAnswer: Critical dependencies include ERP to Database servers, CRM to Email systems, and all systems to Active Directory for authentication.

queries.question: Describe the organizational structure of the operations department.
queries.expectedAnswer: Operations is led by the COO, with Directors for Manufacturing, Logistics, and Quality. Each Director oversees multiple team leads.

queries.question: What risks are associated with the invoice processing workflow?
queries.expectedAnswer: Key risks include duplicate payments, unauthorized approvals, late payment penalties, and fraud through fictitious vendors.

queries.question: How does the company ensure quality control across manufacturing?
queries.expectedAnswer: Quality control includes incoming inspection, in-process checks, final testing, and periodic ISO audits with corrective action tracking.

queries.question: Provide an executive overview of technology investments and their business impact.
queries.expectedAnswer: Key investments include cloud migration (30% cost reduction), CRM upgrade (20% sales efficiency), and automation (40% manual task reduction).

queries.question: What training programs exist for new employees?
queries.expectedAnswer: Training includes company orientation, role-specific onboarding, compliance training (GDPR, security), and ongoing professional development.

queries.question: Explain the end-to-end customer order fulfillment process.
queries.expectedAnswer: Order fulfillment starts with order receipt, inventory allocation, picking/packing, shipping, and delivery confirmation with feedback collection.

queries.question: What security controls protect customer data?
queries.expectedAnswer: Controls include encryption at rest and in transit, access controls (RBAC), audit logging, regular penetration testing, and incident response procedures.

queries.question: How are KPIs measured and reported across the organization?
queries.expectedAnswer: KPIs are tracked in dashboards, reported monthly to leadership, with automated alerts for threshold breaches and quarterly trend analysis.

queries.question: What disaster recovery procedures are in place for critical systems?
queries.expectedAnswer: DR includes daily backups, off-site replication, documented recovery procedures, annual DR testing, and defined RTO/RPO targets.
